alert.note: Alert for Eastern Ulster; Western Dutchess (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albany (Eastern New York and Western New England)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 26 at 3:28PM EDT by NWS Albany
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of east central Ulster and northwestern Dutchess Counties through 400 PM EDT... At 327 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Hurley, or near Kingston, moving east at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Kingston, Rhinebeck, Hurley, Red Hook, Lake Katrine, Staatsburg, Port Ewen, Marbletown, Rolling Meadows, Kerleys Corners, Maple Hill, Sweet Meadows, Linden Acres, Hillside, Fraleighs, Morgan Hill, Eighmyville, Jockey Hill, Halihan Hill and Kallops Corners. Those attending the Dutchess County Fair are in the path of this storm and should prepare for IMMINENT DANGEROUS WEATHER CONDITIONS. People attending Dutchess County Fair should seek safe shelter immediately! This includes Interstate 87 near exit 19. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. This storm may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 800 PM EDT for east central New York.
